required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Comparison of Airway Sealing With the Laryngeal Mask Airway (LMA) Supreme at Different Intracuff Pressure in Children

brief_summary.textblock: The laryngeal mask airway (LMA) supreme is a relatively new single-use supraglottic airway with modification. The parameters about airway sealing such as oropharyngeal leak pressure (OLP) and leakage volume are important markers of efficacy and safety when using the supraglottic airway. The airway sealing is related to the intracuff pressure of laryngeal mask airway. The aim of this study is to compare the airway sealing of the LMA supreme at various intracuff pressure in children.

primary_outcome.time_frame: approximately 5 minutes after adjusting intracuff pressure

intervention.intervention_name: intracuff pressure by cuff pressure manometer
intervention.description: 36 patients are randomly allocated according to random sequence of the intracuff pressure 40, 60 and 80 cmH2O. After insertion of LMA supreme, we confirm adequate ventilation. And then we measure OLP and leakage volume at intra-cuff pressure 40, 60 and 80 cmH2O adjusted by cuff pressure manometer according to random sequence of the intracuff pressure.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pediatric patients (less than 108months of age)
- scheduled for elective surgery undergoing general anesthesia using LMA supreme 1.5-2.5
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with an abnormal airway,
- reactive airway disease,
- gastroesophageal reflux disease,
- chronic respiratory disease,
- a history of an upper respiratory tract infection

reference.citation: Zhang L, Seet E, Mehta V, Subramanyam R, Ankichetty SP, Wong DT, Chung F. Oropharyngeal leak pressure with the laryngeal mask airway Supremeâ„¢ at different intracuff pressures: a randomized controlled trial.
